Name: ln
Description: The command creates links to files, allowing for multiple references to the same data without duplicating storage.

Arguments.Name: L
Arguments.Description: The `-L` argument creates a hard link to the target of a symbolic link.

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: When creating a hard link to a symbolic link, it creates a hard link to the symbolic link itself.

Arguments.Name: F
Arguments.Description: The `-F` argument removes a target file if it already exists and is a directory before creating a link.

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: The `-f` argument force unlinks the target file if it already exists before creating a new link.

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: Prompts for confirmation before overwriting an existing file.

Arguments.Name: h
Arguments.Description: The `-h` argument prevents following symbolic links when creating links.

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: The `-n` option prevents following symbolic links.

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: The `-v` argument displays files as they are being processed.

Arguments.Name: w
Arguments.Description: The `-w` argument warns if the source of a symbolic link does not currently exist.

Arguments.Name: pathname
Arguments.Description: The path argument passed to the command creates a new directory entry (linked file) for the specified file name.
